name: testRigor
headline: Executable specifications in English for test automation
description: testRigor is an executable specifications engine to help companies to empower their manual QA to be able to build automation 15X than QA engineers and spend 200X less time maintaining the code.

founders.name: Artem Golubev, Founder
founders.description: I Love helping companies to solve test maintenance problems. Check us out on https://testrigor.com

generated_description:
testRigor is an innovative company founded in 2015 and is a part of Y Combinator's Batch S21. Based in San Francisco with a team of 25 employees, their mission is to simplify test automation by allowing users to write executable specifications in plain English. Essentially, testRigor transforms what traditionally could take a highly technical QA engineer hours into something that can be accomplished swiftly and efficiently by manual QA testers—up to 15 times faster and with 200 times less time spent maintaining code.

They excel in using AI technologies to automate testing, making it accessible for anyone on the team to contribute. Instead of delving into complicated coding processes, users can specify actions such as "purchase a Kindle," and testRigor translates that into actionable test steps like searching for the product and adding it to the cart. This focus on usability promises increased productivity and reduced maintenance burdens, which many organizations struggle with.

With over 54,000 companies counting on testRigor, its solutions encompass web testing, mobile testing, desktop testing, and more, using a robust platform that integrates easily with popular tools like GitHub, Jenkins, and Azure DevOps. They prioritize security, following industry standards like SOC2 and HIPAA, ensuring that user data remains confidential.

testRigor's platform is particularly valuable for those looking to enhance test coverage without the media costs usually associated with more technical solutions. It has garnered recognition as a "Cool Vendor" by Gartner in 2023, highlighting its innovative edge in the software engineering sector.

In summary, testRigor represents a forward-thinking approach to test automation, making it accessible and efficient while resolving some of the core inefficiencies in traditional testing methodologies. If you're seeking a solution that minimizes maintenance and amplifies productivity, it might be well worth exploring what testRigor can do for your organization—check out their offerings at [testRigor.com](https://testrigor.com).
